step_1_context.text: Employees must wear ID cards, and visitors have to sign in at reception.

step_2_explanation.simple_rule: Use must/have to for obligation and necessity.
step_2_explanation.formula: must + base verb | have/has to + base verb
step_2_explanation.common_mistake: Do not use must in past forms; use had to for past necessity.

step_3_interactive_exercises.question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: Yesterday I had to finish early.
Yesterday I have to finish early.
Yesterday I must to finish early.
step_3_interactive_exercises.correct_answer: Yesterday I had to finish early.
step_3_interactive_exercises.explanation_for_failure: Past necessity is expressed with had to.

step_3_interactive_exercises.error_analysis: Modal verbs do not take -s in third person.
